answers.answer: Hi,it is normal for blood sugars to rise during infection.  However, even while ill, I don't thing that blood sugars would be as high as you describe. To have blood sugars of the level you describe definitely requires further thorough investigation and likely treatment.It may be that you have diabetes and that you are lucky enough to find out about it before you have any symptoms or complications.

question: I suffered from typhoid and pneumonia for about 12 days and when I had the blood test during 4th or 5th day of infection,I had blood sugar around 160 (fasting) and 240 (post fasting).Now I dont have any symptoms of diabetes (though I am planning to go for another test soon).Can some one explain, if this is out of normal behavior during infection.cheersPPKumar
title: Blood sugar during or post typhoid
